intro: Allium bouddae, commonly known as the purple dragon garlic, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It is characterized by its striking violet-purple inflorescence, which resembles a dragon's head, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It produces small, white, spherical bulbs that are edible but often used more for decorative purposes. Allium bouddae thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
